prompt: Puis-je authentifier les utilisateurs avec des jetons d'accès ?
expected_answer:
Oui, vous pouvez authentifier les utilisateurs avec des jetons d'accès en utilisant l'extension d'authentification basée sur les jetons pour l'application LLM.

Cette extension permet aux applications externes d'authentifier les utilisateurs avec des jetons Web JSON signés (JWT). Le jeton doit contenir des revendications spécifiques, telles que la date d'expiration, l'émetteur, le sujet et la audience, et doit être signé avec une clé Ed25519.

Pour utiliser cet authentificateur, vous devez :

1. Activer l'authentificateur de jeton en définissant la propriété `xwiki.authentication.authclass` dans le fichier `xwiki.properties` sur `org.xwiki.contrib.llm.authentication.JWTTokenAuth`.
2. Configurer les applications autorisées en ajoutant une nouvelle entrée à la liste des « Applications autorisées », en spécifiant le titre, l'URL, la clé publique et le format de groupe de l'application.
3. Générer un jeton JWT qui répond aux exigences de revendications et de clés de signature.
4. Inclure le jeton dans l'en-tête « Authorization » de la requête sous la forme « Bearer TOKEN ».

Notez que cet authentificateur ne prend en charge que la création ou la mise à jour des utilisateurs en fonction des informations fournies dans le jeton et ne prend pas en charge l'utilisation d'un jeton comme authentification pour un utilisateur existant qui n'a pas été créé via cet authentificateur.

sources.content:
**Contents*** [Upgrading](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HUpgrading)
	+ [Part 1 Upgrading the distribution](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HPart1Upgradingthedistribution)
		- [Method 1.A Upgrading from the Debian package .DEB](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HMethod1.AUpgradingfromtheDebianpackage.DEB)
		- [Method 1.B Upgrading from Docker .Docker](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HMethod1.BUpgradingfromDocker.Docker)
		- [Method 1.C Upgrading the WAR .WAR](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HMethod1.CUpgradingtheWAR.WAR)
		- [Method 1.D Upgrading the demo package .ZIP](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HMethod1.DUpgradingthedemopackage.ZIP)
	+ [Part 2 Upgrading the flavor](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HPart2Upgradingtheflavor)
		- [Using Distribution Wizard](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HUsingDistributionWizard)
	+ [Alternative Start fresh, plus Export and Reimport your data](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HAlternativeStartfresh2CplusExportandReimportyourdata)
* [Downgrading](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HDowngrading)
* [Troubleshooting](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HTroubleshooting)
	+ [XWiki won't start without any error in the log and stay stuck on Solr initialization](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Upgrade/#HXWikiwon27tstartwithoutanyerrorinthelogandstaystuckonSolrinitialization)
Note 1 XWiki provides migration paths to upgrade from any older version to any newer one. You don't need to upgrade to intermediary versions.

* [Description](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HDescription)
	+ [Provided Features](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HProvidedFeatures)
		- [Users & Rights](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HUsers26Rights)
			* [Users](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HUsers)
			* [Groups](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HGroups)
			* [Rights](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HRights)
			* [Extension Rights](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HExtensionRights)
			* [User Profile](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HUserProfile)
			* [User Directory](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HUserDirectory)
			* [Registration](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HRegistration)
				+ [Activating captchas](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HActivatingcaptchas)
				+ [Options you can set from the Registration section of the Administration Interface](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HOptionsyoucansetfromtheRegistrationsectionoftheAdministrationInterface)
				+ [Things which you may configure by editing XWiki.Registration](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HThingswhichyoumayconfigurebyeditingXWiki.Registration)
				+ [Validation Constraints](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HValidationConstraints)
			* [Invitation](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application#HInvitation)

#### Rights

Manage the group and user rights: control who can view, edit and delete pages.

![rights.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Administration%20Application/rights.png?rev=1.3)

See also the [Authentication guide](https://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Authentication/) and the [Access rights information](https://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Access%20Rights/).

#### Extension Rights

XWiki 13.5+ A new section has been added to allow settings the Extension Rights: those rights are not part of XWiki core and are provided by extensions. By default, in XWiki Standard the UI displays the Like right, but other rights can be added depending on the installed extensions.

![extension-rights-ui.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Administration%20Application/extension-rights-ui.png?rev=1.1)



#### User Profile

Manage what information is displayed on the user profile of each user.

![profile.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Administration%20Application/profile.png?rev=1.3)

#### User Directory

See the [User Directory](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Directory%20Application) application.
